fields.description:
Database request is performed before each schedule job is run. If this request fails for any reason (e.g. connection timeout, not enough DB connections in the pool, table missing in DB), the scheduled job will be prevented from running until the instance is restarted.

This is the relevant stack trace:
{noformat}
org.quartz.SchedulerException: JobListener 'ScheduledJobListener' threw exception: Could not open Hibernate Session for transaction; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: Cannot open connection [See nested exception: org.springframework.transaction.CannotCreateTransactionException: Could not open Hibernate Session for transaction; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: Cannot open connection]
	at org.quartz.core.QuartzScheduler.notifyJobListenersToBeExecuted(QuartzScheduler.java:1951)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.notifyListenersBeginning(JobRunShell.java:364)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:190)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.quartz.ConfluenceQuartzThreadPool.lambda$runInThread$187(ConfluenceQuartzThreadPool.java:19)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:549)
Caused by: org.springframework.transaction.CannotCreateTransactionException: Could not open Hibernate Session for transaction; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: Cannot open connection
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager.doBegin(HibernateTransactionManager.java:473)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.getTransaction(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:374)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor49.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:198)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy33.getTransaction(Unknown Source)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionAspectSupport.createTransactionIfNecessary(TransactionAspectSupport.java:263)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:101)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy142.jobToBeExecuted(Unknown Source)
	at org.quartz.core.QuartzScheduler.notifyJobListenersToBeExecuted(QuartzScheduler.java:1949)
	... 4 more
Caused by: net.sf.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: Cannot open connection
	at net.sf.hibernate.exception.SQLStateConverter.handledNonSpecificException(SQLStateConverter.java:80)
	at net.sf.hibernate.exception.SQLStateConverter.convert(SQLStateConverter.java:69)
	at net.sf.hibernate.exception.JDBCExceptionHelper.convert(JDBCExceptionHelper.java:29)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.BatcherImpl.convert(BatcherImpl.java:328)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.BatcherImpl.openConnection(BatcherImpl.java:295)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.connection(SessionImpl.java:3367)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager.doBegin(HibernateTransactionManager.java:422)
	... 17 more
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Cannot get a connection, pool error Timeout waiting for idle object
	at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp2.PoolingDataSource.getConnection(PoolingDataSource.java:126)
	at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp2.BasicDataSource.getConnection(BasicDataSource.java:1412)
	at net.sf.hibernate.connection.DatasourceConnectionProvider.getConnection(DatasourceConnectionProvider.java:59)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.BatcherImpl.openConnection(BatcherImpl.java:292)
	... 20 more
	at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.pool2.impl.GenericObjectPool.borrowObject(GenericObjectPool.java:446)
	at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.pool2.impl.GenericObjectPool.borrowObject(GenericObjectPool.java:360)
	at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp2.PoolingDataSource.getConnection(PoolingDataSource.java:118)
	... 23 more
{noformat}

Two job listeners are called when execution is starting:

# {{ExecutingJobsManager}} keeps a list of jobs which are executing
# {{ScheduledJobsListener}} saves execution details to database

If {{ScheduledJobsListener}} throws an exception, {{ExecutingJobsManager}} will not get notified that the execution got cancelled. Further executions get cancelled because {{AbstractJob#executeInternal(..)}} checks {{ExecutingJobsManager}} to see if similar (but not same) execution is already happening.

*Workaround for Confluence 5.8*

For users of Confluence 5.8.18, we are providing a [patch file|^confluence-5.8.18-CONF-39825-patch.zip]  containing a fix for this issue. Please be aware that this patch has not been fully tested and is applied at your own risk. We strongly recommend that you test the patch on a staging instance of Confluence before applying it to a production instance. Refer to https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/installing-patched-class-files-166528493.html for details on how to apply the patch. Also, make sure that the MaxWaitMillis is set to 10000 so that the connection pool got sometime to recover.
fields.summary: Quartz scheduled jobs can stop running until restart

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
With recent version Confluence Data Center the only possible way to discover other cluster nodes is sending a request on UDP port of multicast address. In some environments like secured corporate networks and some cloud providers like Amazon AWS (VPC) and Google Cloud, it blocks the discovery mechanism. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the possibility to configure discovery using unicast.
h3. Workaround
No workaround available currently.
fields.summary: Using unicast for discover cluster nodes in Confluence Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When clicking Edit on a page in Confluence, if there is any javascript file loaded via the html macro, then it takes about 20 seconds before the editor is displayed. The problem appears to be caused by the Quick Edit Plugin in combination with compressing HTTP responses.

h3. Additional Note
This issue affects the page load as well. Please refer to the following screencasts for detailed information.
• Issue reproducible on Confluence 5.8.14 - [^Confluence-5.8.14-Reproducible.mp4]
• Issue non-reproducible on Confluence 5.7.5 - [^Confluence-5.7.5-Non-Reproducible.mp4]

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Enable the HTML macro as per [the documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/HTML+Macro]
# Drop a javascript file (i.e. [^sample.js]) into <confluence-install>/confluence/WEB-INF/includes/js
# Create a page
# Insert a HTML macro containing the below, with the context path and filename changed to match the real file (the problem does not reproduce if the file doesn't exist):
{code:none}
<script type="text/javascript" src="/CONTEXT_PATH/includes/js/myjavascript.js"></script>
{code}
# Save the page
# Click "Edit"

h3. Expected Results

The editor should show up almost instantly.

h3. Actual Results

Edit shows a spinner for around 20 seconds before showing the editor.
 
h3. Workaround 1

# Go to "General Configuration" in Confluence Admin and disable "Compress HTTP Responses" this removes the slow page load effect.

h3.Workaround 2

This workaround will disable the Quick Edit plugin for the page editor only automatically on page loads. This means you will not be able to use the keyboard shortcut "e" to edit pages, as a side effect. This corrects the Edit button slow loading. 

# Go to "Custom HTML" in Confluence Administration
# Put the below code into the head section:
{code:none}
<script>
AJS.$(window).load(function(){
    AJS.Confluence.QuickEdit.QuickEditPage.disable();
});
</script>
{code}
# Save the changes
fields.summary: Clicking Edit takes a long time to load the editor when custom javascript files are loaded via the html macro

Currently we ship 200 http threads and 30 db connections to Server by default. We are in the process of changing our Cloud settings to more closely match what we recommend customers set [in our docs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Confluence+slows+and+times+out+during+periods+of+high+load+due+to+database+connection+pool]. We should also ship more closely matched settings to Server.

We are going to ship what we ship to EAC by default - 20/60 min/max for DB and 48 for HTTP.

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, iPython notebooks can be converted to HTML and subsequently copied/pasted as source into the Editor, but images break on Preview and Save.  

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Provide a macro that would  render code and markdown found in iPython notebooks. The code snippets would also be numbered as they are in iPython notebooks.

h3. Workaround 
# Create a html folder in your <confluence-install>\confluence folder.
# Convert the iPython notebook to HTML and save the file to the <confluence-install>\confluence folder. 
# Create a Confluence page and insert a HTML macro.
# Use an iFrame to display to the notebook, by using something like:{code}
<iframe src="http://localhost:8541/confluence/html/example notebook.html" width="800" height="500"></iframe>{code}

*or* 

Use the 3rd party plugin: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/ch.mibex.confluence.ipython-notebook (only available for Confluence Cloud).

fields.description:
The email templates for the actions "Share" and "Mention" don't use the default email subject. Due to this issue the internationalization of the email subject fails!

Please reproduce following steps:
* language setting of Confluence is set to: German
* User "Bob" uses Confluence in English (the language is saved via the profile settings)
* User "Alice" uses Confluence in German (the language is saved via the profile settings)
* User "Charlie" uses Confluence in French (the language is saved via the profile settings)

# Bob shares a page with Alice: -> the subject of Alices email is in German (/). This is a correct behaviour.
# Alice shares a page with Bob: -> the subject of Bobs email is in German (x). In our thoughts the correct subject should be in English!
# Bob shares a page with Charlie: -> the subject of Charlie email is in German (x). In our thoughts the correct subject should be in French!

--> Bob and Charlie don't understand the email subjects and are frustrated! ;(

p.s.: please don't tell me a workaround would be to change the system language into english
We need a better solution for a multi-language Confluence system.

Thank you for paying attention.
fields.summary: missing internationlization for email subjects: "Share" and "Mention"

fields.description:
[Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/upgrading-confluence-data-center-1507377.html] says that cluster nodes should be upgraded individually. If this advice is ignored and multiple nodes are started simultaneously, deferred upgrade tasks might not get executed on some nodes.

This situation should be detected and either serialised or the start-up should be stopped with an error.
fields.summary: Deferred upgrade tasks might not get executed if cluster nodes are upgraded concurrently

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39757].
  {panel}

Every time we shut down our Confluence production system it can take up to 20 minutes to shutdown, and we are often not very confident about killing it when we do shut it down.  It seems the Confluence's process does not properly respond to a SIGTERM most of the time, and must eventually be killed by force (which is what your shutdown scripts do, in one way or another).
Unfortunately, we know that a force-kill too early can result in DB corruption, so we are often hesitant to force-kill.
On the other hand, Confluence shutdown is a major driving factor behind the length of our maintenance windows, which for a mission-critical application is a major problem.

Please improve Confluence shutdown so it responds properly to SIGTERM and shuts down in an orderly fashion, and we are not left guessing about whether a force-kill will result in DB corruption every time we have to shut it down for a maintenance window.
fields.summary: Improve Confluence orderly shutdown

fields.description:
Currently, If you are a Confluence administrator and a user has restricted a page to edit just for himself, the EDIT button still appears in the page, but if the administrator clicks on it and save the page, he'll receive a *Not Permitted* message and if he clicks on *Close*, he's not redirected to the *view* mode.

*Steps to reproduce*:
# Create a 'test' user.
# Create a page with the 'test' user.
# With the Confluence admin account, go to that created page.
# Click on *Edit* and then in *Save*.

*Current Behavior:*
You will receive a *Not permitted* message.

(i) If you click on *Close* instead of *Save*, the page will not be refreshed. You'll see just a *blank* page.

*Expected Behaviour:*
You are able to save the page or Confluence admin will not be able to see the *Edit* button since the page is restricted.
fields.summary: Remove EDIT button if administrator doesn't have permissions to edit pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39751].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if you try to add more than 20 labels at a time in Confluence, you get an error there is a limit. There's no way to change the limit for administrators, and the error simply wipes the list of labels already entered.
This makes it difficult for users that now need to re-enter all of the labels.

!Screen Shot 2015-10-30 at 12.00.21.jpg!
!Screen Shot 2015-10-30 at 12.00.25.jpg!

h3. Suggested Solution
* Change Confluence so that there is no limit
* Provide admins a way to change the limit
* Save the current labels entered so when an error occurs, the user still has a chance to remove extra labels and not have to type them all over again.
 
h3. Workaround 
Enter only 20 labels at a time.
fields.summary: As an administrator, provide a way to increase the label limit on a page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39749].
  {panel}

Current version of JIRA (cloud or server) only use favicon. Unfortunately Apple choose <link rel="mask-icon" ...> for icon rendered inside pinned tabs.

Please add proper configuration for this into Confluence (cloud if possible and server) similar to favicon configuration.

Related info:
https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/AppleApplications/Reference/SafariWebContent/pinnedTabs/pinnedTabs.html
fields.summary: Add mask-icon for Safari Pinned Tab icon

# Create a new LDAP directory in Confluence with setting random user and password, which will fail as expected
# Edit the LDAP directory with deleting the user and password for anonymous bind, which will fail unexpectedly (this is the bug)

h3. Notes
I found _ldap.password_ remains in _cwd_directory_attribute_ table even after deleting the former user and password:
{code}
# SELECT * FROM cwd_directory_attribute where attribute_name = 'ldap.password' OR attribute_name = 'ldap.userdn';
 directory_id | attribute_value | attribute_name 
--------------+-----------------+----------------
        98307 | abc             | ldap.password
(1 row)
{code}
It seems this is the root cause, because anonymous bind succeeds after I delete the record by this SQL query:
{code}
DELETE FROM cwd_directory_attribute where attribute_name = 'ldap.password'
{code}

h3.Workaround
Create a new LDAP directory configuration instead of editing the existing one

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39746].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When running Confluence on MySQL 5.5.x, content indexing takes a significant amount of time compared to when running on MySQL 5.6.x

After running the same 5.5.46 database with the same driver on Confluence 5.8.15, the reindex takes about 5 seconds with the same amount of content.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9.1-OD-2015.39.1-0001
* MySQL 5.5.46

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Stand up a Confluence 5.9.1-OD-2015.39.1-0001 instance
# Fill it with content
# Reindex (from scratch or otherwise)

h3. Expected Results
In a Confluence 5.9.1-OD-2015.39.1-0001 instance running on MySQL 5.6, indexing from scratch takes about 3 seconds.

h3. Actual Results
With this same amount of content (restored from backup) running on MySQL 5.5 the indexing is at 50% after 10 minutes. Each page can take anywhere from 10 seconds to a minute to be indexed. 

We can see multiple threads waiting to run an indexing task:
{noformat}
"confluence-interactive-reindexing-thread" #312 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fb2d4199000 nid=0x7cee waiting on condition [0x00007fb24a669000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00000000b8085f18> (a java.util.concurrent.FutureTask)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.awaitDone(FutureTask.java:429)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:191)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.index.ConfluenceReIndexer.indexHandles(ConfluenceReIndexer.java:245)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.index.ConfluenceReIndexer.lambda$indexType$505(ConfluenceReIndexer.java:205)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.index.ConfluenceReIndexer$$Lambda$324/610274474.perform(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.withWriter(LuceneConnection.java:489)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.index.ConfluenceReIndexer.indexType(ConfluenceReIndexer.java:197)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.index.ConfluenceReIndexer.indexAttachments(ConfluenceReIndexer.java:182)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.index.ConfluenceReIndexer.reIndex(ConfluenceReIndexer.java:128)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.ReIndexTask.run(ReIndexTask.java:43)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.tenant.TenantGate$3.call(TenantGate.java:164)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.lambda$reIndex$390(DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.java:256)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.DefaultConfluenceIndexManager$$Lambda$210/1075520606.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Upgrade MySQL to 5.6
fields.summary: Content indexing is very slow in Confluence using MySQL 5.5

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39744].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Using Emoji on a Confluence Page prevents Inline Commenting

h3. Environment
* Confluence 1000.95 (Cloud) 
* Confluence 5.8.5 (Server)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page in Confluence which includes a Unicode-6 Emoji Character (📷 🏈)
# Attempt to Inline Comment

h3. Expected Results
A comment is added inline to the Page

h3. Actual Results
When attempting to save the Inline Comment, an error appears indicating "Unable to Save The Comment"

Confluence logs show:
{noformat}2016-05-18 22:43:05,223 ERROR [http-bio-1996-exec-49] [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] toResponse Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: [com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxLazyException] Illegal character entity: expansion character (code 0xd83c) not a valid XML character{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Seems to only be affected by [Unicode-6 Emoji|http://emojipedia.org/unicode-6.0/]
Using ⚽️ (not listed in the link above) seems to work

h3.Workaround
Remove Emoji Characters from Page
fields.summary: Using emoji on a page disables inline commenting

fields.description: When I try to resize a gif in Confluence, the image comportment is not correct : - when I resize with the editor UI, if the image is too small, the gif is not animated. - when I resize it with a HTML macro and a img element defined with a width attribute, there is no issues, the image is correctly resized and animated. I tried this with Firefox 41.0.2 and Chrome 46. h6.Workaround To resize the image and retain the animation, use the HTML macro and define a new width in the tag
fields.summary: Issue in resizing gif

fields.description:
I have a script that creates a page from a template and adds a label value to the createPageLabelsString hidden field in the draft version on the page. So the createPageLabelsString hidden field has the labels that are assigned in the template and then custom labels assigned by the code.

The problem is that when the user clicks the label rte-button-labels button, the createPageLabelsString hidden field value is overwritten. The createPageLabelsString hidden field always has the correct data. The rte-button-labels button should pull the list of labels from this field to display it in the popup. Also the page is saved with the labels that are in this hidden field. Therefore the popup should use that field as the source of the label list.

What is interesting is that the rte-button-labels button tooltip recognizes the values in the createPageLabelsString hidden field. But when the button is clicked, the popup does not display what is in the createPageLabelsString hidden field.
fields.summary: Label popup overwrites label field

fields.description:
When I use the blog-posts-macro to display blogposts filtered by tags I would expect a new blogpost created via the "Create blog entry"-button to have those tags assigned by default. 

Otherwise (which is the current behaviour) I'm creating a new blogpost in my filtered list and can'T find it in that same list afterwards which is not understandable for most users.
fields.summary: blog posts created via blog-posts-macro are missing filter-tags

fields.description:
After the migration from Confluence 5.5.6 to Confluence 5.8.9 users (both local and LDAP users) of the group 'confluence-administrators' are not able to add or edit pages, anymore. Once they try to edit a page, they get the 'not permitted' error page although they can perform any other admin action on the sysem (e.g. on the Global Configuration Tab).

We have double checked that the group 'confluence-administrators' has Site and Confluence Administrator Permissions.
fields.summary: Confluence Administrators Cannot Edit Pages
Display Active User Session

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39724].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in Confluence there's no way to force a link to open in a new window, besides the workaround.
Cloud users are unable to apply this due to the [Restricted Functions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Restricted+functions+in+Atlassian+Cloud+apps] in Cloud, preventing added code.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option when creating a new link to choose whether a link opens in a new window.
 
h3. Workaround
# Confluence Server users can follow the workaround at [How to force links to open in a new window|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+force+links+to+open+in+a+new+window]
# Confluence Cloud users will not be able to apply this workaround.
# An option without modifying code would be to use the middle-click on your mouse if you have a three-button mouse, ctrl-click on Windows/Unix, or cmd-click on Mac. This option will also work for Cloud users.
fields.summary: When creating a link, allow ability to choose to open link in new window

All the buttons are displayed properly

the "Like" button is displayed wrongly. It is displayed as:

The button should read as "J'aime"

fields.description:
{{com.atlassian.confluence.event.events.plugin.PluginInstallEvent}} doesn't work well in clustered environments because the current timeout for remote nodes to wait is too short. Consequently erroneous warnings are likely to be added to the logs.

See https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/UPM-5193?focusedCommentId=179496&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-179496 for more information.
fields.summary: Misleading plugin installation timeout messages can appear in logs in clustered environments because com.atlassian.confluence.event.events.plugin.PluginInstallEvent isn't asynchronous

fields.description:
The following URL is vulnerable to Insecure Direct Object Reference, allowing any authenticated user to read configuration files from the application such as the content of webapp directory in confluence.

http://<server>/spaces/viewdefaultdecorator.action?decoratorName=<FILE>
http://<server>/admin/viewdefaultdecorator.action?decoratorName=<FILE>

Where <FILE>  any file readable by the user who runs the Confluence instance is accessible through Confluence itself.

PoC URL:
http://<server>/spaces/viewdefaultdecorator.action?decoratorName=/WEB-INF/web.xml
http://<server>/admin/viewdefaultdecorator.action?decoratorName=/WEB-INF/web.xml

This has been verified in confluence 5.9.1, 5.8.15, and 5.8.14

h2. Workarounds

* Do not run Confluence as root/administrator.  We always recommend creating a dedicated user account to run Atlassian products.  You can limit the impact of this bug by restricting what the app user account can access.
* Block URLs that match this pattern using proxy or load balancer rules.
fields.summary: Insecure Direct Object Reference

fields.description:
I cannot get Space Categories to work correctly after manually adding them to Spaces. If I add a brand new category on a given space, it will also appear as a new Category tab on the Space Directory. However, clicking on that tab yields no results. If I add an existing Category, that tab will not show that Space in the results. Refreshing the Space Directory page doesn't fix it.

If a Category is added to a space *automatically*, such as "teams" Category auto-added when using the Team Space template, then the tab in the Space Directory ALWAYS works. It's only the manual add that fails.

This exact same issue exists if clicking on a Category label of a particular Space. Only the auto-added Spaces-Category associations are shown. Not the manual ones.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# On top menu, click *Spaces* -> *Space directory*
# On side menu, click *Site Spaces*
# Pick a Space and click on the circled "i" icon. This will bring you to *Space Details* -> *Space Operations* for that Space
# On side menu, click *GENERAL* -> *Space Categories*
# Type "test" into input text and click *Add*
# On top menu, click *Spaces* -> *Space directory*
# Notice *Test* has been added under *CATEGORIES* on side menu
# On side menu, click *CATEGORIES* -> *Test*
# Notice "No spaces found." appears in an Info macro.
fields.summary: Space Directory's Category tabs don't work

h3.Summary:
Confluence displays Santiago as GMT-4 in user profile while JIRA says GMT-3.
The correct timezone is GMT-3.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Access user profile.
# Settings > Edit.
# Search for Santiago.

h3. Expected Results
Santiago should displays as GMT-3.

h3. Actual Results
Santiago displays as GMT-4.
fields.summary: Confluence displays the wrong timezone for Santiago.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39701].
  {panel}

Whenever a user tries to edit the Space Permission and update its information, Confluence fails to do so and report the following error:
{code}
[Error] Error: Syntax error, unrecognized expression: [name=confluence_initial_viewspace_group_<instance_group>]
{code}
It happens if the space has given a permission to a group which has a white space in the group name (i.e test group).

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a Space and create a group with a similar name.
For example:
#* Space: Space test
#* Group: Space test

# Try to update the Space Permission by adding the Space test group.
# Hit Save All.

*Expected behaviour*
# The permissions should be updated.

*Actual*
Nothing happens and all buttons are greyed out.
The following error appears on the console:
{code}
[Error] Error: Syntax error, unrecognized expression: [name=confluence_initial_viewspace_group_<instance_group>]
{code}

*Additional info*
Confirmed with Google Chrome and Safari.
It doesn't happen when browsing with Firefox or Internet Explorer.

*Workaround*
Use other browsers, like Mozilla Firefox or Internet Explorer.
fields.summary: Unable to save changes to Space Permissions for a group containing a whitespace

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39700].
  {panel}

*Current situation*
All my clients and collegues ask me the same thing: is there a way to filter tables (especially page property reports) as one can do in MS Excel or LO Calc?

*Suggestion*
The resulting table of a page property report is filterable as implemented in e.g. MS Excel. For each column there is a dropdown that contains all distinct (text-)values that exist in the given column. It is possible to combine the filters of two or more columns.
See the attached images for further information.
fields.summary: MS Excel-/LibreOffice Calc like column filtering for page property report tables
Create 'User Management' Permission Role

# Open a Space admin page then open the integration tab. 
# Open a new tab on the browser and open the manage add-on page. 
# Disable the plugin "Confluence HipChat Plugin" 
# Refresh the Space Admin page, the hipchat integration tab still here. 
# Disable the plugin "Confluence Hipchat Integration Plugin 
# Refresh the Space Admin page, the hipchat integration tab still here but with a blank page.
# Disable the plugin "Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin Core"
# Refresh the Space Admin page.

h3. Expected behaviour: 
The hipchat tab should be disappear. 

h3. Actually behaviour:
The browser is kept loading infinitively, with the error :

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39688].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a page is moved to a different space, the previous URL no longer works. Page appears showing the page has been moved to another space. 

h3. Suggested Solution
The previous URL should still be valid and redirect to the page where it has been moved.
fields.summary: As a user I want to move pages to a different space and have the old URL redirect to the new URL

fields.description:
After saving a page confluence stores text on top or below page layout borders (compare the attached PNG screenshot). After that, it is not possible to edit the text outside the page layout borders.

Workaround: create a blank page, copy paste all editable contents from the defective page to the blank page, save the new page, delete the old page.
fields.summary: Text not editable because it's outside page layout borders

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After performing an XML export import to another instance, the order of User Directory that has been set in the old instance seem to be swapped in the new instance. For some certain configuration, this causes Admins and Users not able to log in to Confluence

h3. Environment:
# Replicated this issue in Confluence 5.7.3
# Behavior not observed in Confluence 5.8.14

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a fresh Confluence instance
# Add an external user directory (tested with Apache external directory)
# Make sure that the directory is on position number 2, while Confluence Internal Directory is on the highest position.
# Create an XML backup of this instance
# Import it to a new instance of the same version
# Log in, and check the order of the user directory set

h3. Expected Results
User Directory order is exactly the same as the one configured in the old version (Confluence Internal Directory on top)

h3. Actual Results
The User Directory order is different than the one originally set. (Confluence Internal Directory is on the second position while External User directory was on top)

h3. Workaround
Follow the instructions in the documentation below to change the user directory position in the database level
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF57/Restoring+Passwords+To+Recover+Admin+User+Rights
fields.summary: Importing XML of site backup resulted with user directory position swap

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39681].
  {panel}

Viewing a page with more than 16 independent JIRA table macros can cause Confluence Cloud to not respond for two minutes, due to database connection contention/starvation. This is due to changes in the macro deployed on 26 Oct, which load tables of JIRA issues via AJAX rather than including them in the page rendering.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Set up an instance (e.g. Cloud) with 16 database connections, and at least 50 HTTP threads.
# Create a page with 16+ JIRA table macros, all with different data
# View the page
# The page will load, but subsequent requests will not load until the JIRA macros time out after 2 minutes. A thread dump taken on the instance will show the "Jira macros executor" threads blocked waiting for a database connection:

{noformat}
Jira macros executor:thread-1" #163 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x0e5fd800 nid=0x338c in Object.wait() [0x2a388000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (on object monitor)
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
	at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.pool.impl.GenericObjectPool.borrowObject(GenericObjectPool.java:1123)
	- locked <0x861964a0> (a org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.pool.impl.GenericObjectPool$Latch)
{noformat}

In the situation where all the database connections are currently leased out to request threads, all JIRA table AJAX requests block on the JIRA macro executor threads which are blocked waiting for a database connection. The result is database connection starvation for all requests until the macro executor thread times out (2 minutes).

h3. Workarounds

There are two possible workarounds, which can be and have been implemented by our support team upon request:

# Disable the JIRA macro
# Change the HTTP/database connection pool sizes from 200/16 to 16/24 and restart the instance.

Over the last week, Atlassian has been proactively monitoring customer logs for any instances of the problem and applying the workaround #2 to these customer instances.

h3. Fix

The Atlassian team is currently rolling out a fix to Confluence Cloud. The fix consists of an updated version of the JIRA macro that reverts the new AJAX functionality and therefore does not exhibit this problem. This rollout will be completed on Wed 4 Nov 2015, with a short outage for Confluence at the appropriate maintenance time for each geo.

Note that prior to 26 Oct, this macro often resulted in individual page timeouts on pages containing 10+ JIRA macros, and this less-than-ideal behaviour will reoccur after the macro is reverted. However, these timeouts only affected individual pages and not other requests to the system.

If you continue to experience problems with the JIRA macro or pages timing out in your instance, please [raise a support case|https://support.atlassian.com] and we will investigate further.

h3. Support notes

Support team, for proper problem diagnosis, please capture:

* thread dumps while the instance is non-responsive, and
* the content of affected pages.

If the problem is caused by this bug, the thread dump will show the JIRA macro processing threads blocked as described above. Other problems can exhibit the same symptoms of non-responsiveness, and it's important that we get the thread dump so we can fix all the root causes that result in this outcome.
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud stops responding after viewing a page with many JIRA issue tables
